collections.name: Heritage Line
collections.subtitle: Ancestral Traditions
collections.description: Strictly traditional silhouettes honoring Northern Ghanaian weaving heritage. These are ceremonial pieces and expressions of cultural authority. Worn for important occasions, state events, and moments that demand dignity and presence.
collections.longDescription: The Heritage Line represents the purest expression of Lambon's commitment to preserving ancestral craft. Each piece is woven using centuries-old techniques and embodies the spiritual and cultural knowledge of Northern Ghana's master weavers. These are not everyday garments—they are investments in cultural continuity and personal legacy.
collections.targetAudience: Early professionals seeking accessible premium heritage
collections.description_short: Traditional silhouettes for ceremonies and authority

collections.name: Statesman Line
collections.subtitle: Modern Leadership
collections.description: Refined professional wear for offices, institutions, and leadership. The Statesman Line bridges ancestral craft with contemporary formality. These garments allow African professionals to bring cultural pride into boardrooms, government offices, and global stages without compromise.
collections.longDescription: The Statesman Line is designed for professionals who understand that clothing is communication. When you wear Lambon Statesman, you're saying: 'I am rooted. I am confident. I lead with purpose.' These pieces work in formal professional settings while maintaining authentic cultural expression. Board meetings, diplomatic events, corporate presentations—the Statesman line commands respect while honoring heritage.
collections.description_short: Refined professional wear for offices and institutions
collections.wearerProfile: CEOs, Government Officials, Corporate Leaders, Cultural Ambassadors

collections.name: Future Line
collections.subtitle: Contemporary Global
collections.description: Contemporary global fashion using traditional smock fabric. The Future Line reimagines ancestral textiles through a modern lens. These pieces bridge heritage and contemporary style for professionals who move between traditional and global contexts.
collections.longDescription: The Future Line asks: What happens when we honor ancestral textile traditions but cut them with contemporary tailoring? The answer is pieces that feel fresh, wearable, and utterly unique. Worn by creatives, entrepreneurs, and cultural leaders who refuse to choose between heritage and modernity. These garments are conversation starters—invitations to discuss the intersection of tradition and innovation.
collections.description_short: Contemporary global fashion using smock fabric
collections.wearerProfile: Entrepreneurs, Artists, Cultural Innovators, Diaspora Professionals
